Module devon.inventorymanager
Package devon.inventorymanager.controller

Class Modfiy_Part_Controller

java.lang.Object
devon.inventorymanager.controller.Modfiy_Part_Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class Modfiy_Part_Controller extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the Modify_Part_Controller class. This class handles modifying part details. The user is able to modify name, inventory, price, min, max, machineID, company name.

  • Method Details

    • setPart

      public void setPart(Part part)
      This is the setPart method. This method populates the screen with the existing part information
      Parameters:
      part - The part to be modified

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This is the initialize method. This method is called during initialization and sets up the initial state of a part. The ID field is disabled and the radio buttons are set.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location of the Modify Part.fxml
      resourceBundle - The resource bundle used for initialization

    • onModifyInHouse

      public void onModifyInHouse(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the onModifyInHouse method. This method is called when the InHouse toggle button is selected. When the InHouse radio button is selected the label is changed to machine ID and a machine ID must be entered not a company name.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by selecting the InHouse radio button

    • onModifyOutsourced

      public void onModifyOutsourced(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the onModifyOutsourced method. This method is called when the Outsourced radio button is selected. When the Outsourced radio button is selected the label is changed to Company Name and a company name must be entered not a machine ID

    • onModifyPartCancel

      public void onModifyPartCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the onModifyPartCancel method. This method is called whe the user clicks the cancel button on the modify part screen. when cancel is clicked changes are not saved the application goes back to the main screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by pressing the cancel button
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onSave

      public void onSave(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the onSave method. This method is called when the save button is clicked. The modified part information is saved and updated in the inventory.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by clicking the save button.
      Throws:
      IOException
